chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Dale Rockman

records.addlTxt:
1:02 PM Judge Anthony Stella Jr. appears by video from the Iron County Courthouse. Defendant Christopher Dale Rockman in court.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared by telephone call for Christopher Dale Rockman.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Hearing is scheduled as an arraignment. Atty Thomas-Schmidt experiences some technical difficulties. Atty Sortedahl states that Information has been filed. Atty Thomas-Schmidt acknowledges information, waives reading. Atty Thomas-Schmidt enters Not Guilty for Counts 1 & 2. Court enters NG Plea to all counts. Court discussion follows for Status Conference scheduling.  All parties agree, Court schedules. Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Arraignment on October 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
(Reprinted with Judge Stella's Zoom Info)

9:51 AM Defendant Christopher Dale Rockman in court.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared by video for Christopher Dale Rockman.  Attorney Bruce Poquette appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court reviews the court record. DEF comments on bond modification. State wishes to proceed with Arraignment. Atty Thomas-Schmidt requests for the CBS bond to be reduced despite posting the amount, wishes to reduce the amount to $500 CBS. State objects to bond modification. DEF makes comment to the Court. Court addresses the bond modification, Court denies the bond modification. Atty Thomas-Schmidt does not wish to proceed with the Arraignment as she was unable to obtain contact. DEF gives phone number. Court sets Arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on October 14, 2022 at 09:50 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: NOH returned from 9966N State RD 27 Hayward, WI 54843

11:31 AM Defendant Christopher Dale Rockman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared by video for Christopher Dale Rockman.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Thomas-Schmidt indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.    State calls witness, City of Hayward, Officer Marshal Savitski sworn in by court.  State begins examination.    11:35 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.  Court addresses DEF.  11:35 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Thomas-Schmidt. 11:37 AM, Court mutes the jail due to interruptions by DEF.  11:37 AM  Cross examination continues.  11:38 AM Attny Thomas-Schmidt no further questions.  11:38  AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Thomas-Schmidt makes argument.  State makes argument.   Arguments continues.  Court makes statement.   Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:01 AM Defendant Christopher Dale Rockman appeared by video, from the Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared by video for Christopher Dale Rockman.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF verifies DOB and address. DEF advised of rights/penalties. Def Atty asks for preliminary hearing to be set. Court sets Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:26 AM Defendant Christopher Dale Rockman JR appeared by video. from the Sawyer County Jail. Atty Gabriel Pollak makes special appearance for Defendant Christopher Dale Rockman Jr. Attorney Jennifer Gross appears for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB. DE does qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Court mutes the jail due to DEF interruption. Atty Pollak argues bond, Court discussion follows. Court sets bond.

COURT: CBS $2500 
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.
